page.title: 10CUSTOMS OFFICERS, ST.HELIER
page.content: The Customs Officers start work at 8 am. They go first to check the cargoes of ships in the Harbour against the manifest to make sure that the correct duty is paid on all goods entering the island. Almost all the things the island needs have to be imported, and all have different rates of duty on them. This duty helps bring in large sums in revenue. In one year alone the duty on petrol comes to Â£1.5m. There is a duty on all wines either imported or local. Every barrel of spirits is tested for volume and strength and every 3 or 4 days the local brewery is checked. A major concern is to prevent the entry of animals from France because of the risk of rabies, but there is free movement to Britain. Sadly,the Customs Officer must now keep a close watch for drug smuggling.
